item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Saturday, April 5, 2025 at 1:20 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Earth's clouds are shrinking, boosting global warming (41 points | 11 comments)
2. The Importance of Fact-Checking (27 points | 7 comments)
3. California now has more EV charging ports than gas nozzles (43 points | 34 comments)
4. Recreating Daft Punk's Something About Us (103 points | 18 comments)
5. Show HN: OCR pipeline for ML training (tables, diagrams, math, multilingual) (94 points | 12 comments)
6. World's largest wildlife crossing reaches critical milestone. Now what? (26 points | 14 comments)
7. The blissful Zen of a good side project (363 points | 101 comments)
8. OpenVertebrate Presents a Database of 13,000 3D Scans of Specimens (99 points | 12 comments)
9. Is Python Code Sensitive to CPU Caching? (2024) (10 points | 1 comment)
10. Protoplanetary Disks Are Smaller Than Expected (15 points | 1 comment)
11. Coolify: Open-source and self-hostable Heroku / Netlify / Vercel alternative (237 points | 93 comments)
12. Pytest for Neovim (42 points | 5 comments)
13. Understanding Machine Learning: From Theory to Algorithms (353 points | 45 comments)
14. An interactive-speed Linux computer made of only 3 8-pin chips (322 points | 103 comments)
15. Scientists witness living plant cells generate cellulose and form cell walls (18 points | discuss)
16. Annotated Unix Magic Poster (112 points | 13 comments)
17. The End of Sierra as We Knew It, Part 1: The Acquisition (239 points | 94 comments)

19. Configuration Complexity Clock (2012) (21 points | 7 comments)
20. Major endometriosis study reveals impact of gluten, coffee, dairy and alcohol (45 points | 10 comments)
21. Show HN: Pets for Cursor (52 points | 7 comments)
22. Why Does Claude Speak Byzantine Music Notation? (116 points | 65 comments)
23. Show HN: Clawtype v2.1 – a one-hand chorded USB keyboard and mouse [video] (64 points | 16 comments)
24. Are porn algorithms feeding a generation of paedophiles – or creating one? (17 points | 6 comments)
25. Kerosene did not save the sperm whale (2024) (176 points | 60 comments)
26. Sparks – A typeface for creating sparklines in text without code (36 points | 16 comments)
27. Show HN: uWrap.js – A faster and more accurate text wrapping util in < 2KB (84 points | 12 comments)
28. Investigating MacPaint's Source Code (54 points | 16 comments)
29. Show HN: Corral – A Visual Logic Puzzle About Enclosing Numbers (22 points | 10 comments)
30. Ferron – A fast, memory-safe web server written in Rust (102 points | 66 comments)
